channel.title: Resources
channel.description: This page is more than just a history of Les Clark specifically, it is a resource for animators and historians studying animation. For that reason, I’m including a list of all the resources I consulted for this project. Please also see the link to the ASIFA Animation Archive in Burbank, as well as the finding aid for the John Canemaker Animation Collection, which contains the largest archival collection of animation resources available to the public.

item.title: Books
item.description: Below is a bibliography split into two sections - Animation History and Animation Technique. It includes some of the most iconic books on the history of Disney (see the Canemaker, Maltin, and Solomon books) as well as new additions by modern historians and animators like Amid Amidi’s Cartoon Modern.

item.title: Periodicals
item.description: Below is a bibliography of periodical resources about all kinds of animation subjects, from technical subjects (see the American Cinematographer, Millimeter and Journal of SMPTE articles) to critical reviews in Film Journal, New York Times and the LA Times.

item.title: Web Resources
item.description: The online animation community is full of knowledgeable people, including historians, experts working in the field, archivists and students. Here is a sampling of websites where you can find information about a wide variety of animation-related subjects:
